wikipedia_page.main: Ruqsana Begum (Bengali: রুকসানা বেগম; born 15 October 1983) is an English professional kickboxer and boxer. She was a British and World Kickboxing Association female Atomweight (48–50 kg) Muay Thai boxing champion and captain of the British Muay Thai Team. In March 2018, Begum made the switch from professional kickboxing to boxing.

response: * Ruqsana Begum, first British woman in kickboxing to be Asian, Bangladeshi and Muslim, she practises Muay Thai
*nickname of English professional kickboxer Ruqsana Begum (born 1983)

In 2012, British kickboxing champion Ruqsana Begum was among the nine people of Bangladeshi descent who carried the Olympic torch along with some 8,000 Britons across the UK. Architectural and graphic designer Saiman Miah was the designer for the two commemorative £5 coins released by British Royal Mint to mark the 2012 London Olympic Games. Akram Khan was a choreographer of the Olympic opening ceremony. Khan was in direction when 12,000 dance artistes performed in the Olympic opening ceremony. Enam Ali's Le Raj restaurant was selected as one of the official food suppliers of the London Olympics. The restaurant also prepared and provided Iftar to the Muslim guests at the Olympics.

* Ruqsana Begum – Muay Thai kickboxer. In 2010, she became the current British female atomweight (48–50 kg) Muay Thai boxing champion. In September 2012, she was nominated as captain of the British Muay Thai Team.
* Ruqsana Begum – 2010 female atomweight Muay Thai kickboxing champion and nominated captain of the British Muay Thai Team.
* Ruqsana Begum (born 1983), English kickboxer and boxer

* Ruqsana Begum  Muay Thai kickboxer; in 2010, became the current British female Atomweight (48–50 kg) Muay Thai boxing champion; in September 2012, she was nominated as captain of the British Muay Thai Team
Media personalities have included Nina Hossain, Konnie Huq and Tasmin Lucia-Khan. Other notable entries include British kickboxing champion Ruqsana Begum and singer Mumzy Stranger.
After going 9-4 in her next thirteen fights, La Notte faced Ruqsana Begum for the ISKA World Muay Thai Atomweight Championship. La Notte won the fight by TKO.
| 13 Apr 2013|| Win||align=left| Ruqsana Begum || Last Man Standing || Birmingham, England || TKO || 3 || 3:00||
In 2015, Lasnier faced Ruqsana Begum for the ISKA Women's World K-1 Rules Flyweight Title. Lasnier won a unanimous decision. She defended the title three months later against Sara Falchetti.
| 14 Mar 2015|| Win||align=left| Ruqsana Begum || World Title Fight || London, England || Decision (Unanimous) || 3 || 3:00
